DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to implement an optimized perioperative course for patients undergoing acute high-risk abdominal surgery in order to improve the outcome. The optimized perioperative course consists of a number of interventions carried out before, during and after surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Acute High-risk Abdominal Surgery Study - an Optimized Perioperative Course
DOC.detailed_description: Emergency surgery is associated with high mortality rates, post-operative complications and prolonged duration of hospital admission. The investigators will implement a multidisciplinary optimized perioperative course consisting of a number of interventions carried out before, during and after surgery. Hypothesis: An optimized perioperative course will reduce the 30-day mortality in emergency abdominal surgery patients. The investigators will do a post-hoc analysis of the data registered.
DOC.criteria: patients undergoing primary emergency laparotomy or laparoscopy patients undergoing reoperation after abdominal surgery. Age > 18 years Appendectomy Emergency laparoscopic cholecystectomy Emergency diagnostic laparoscopy without intervention
